intro: Excoecaria yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan croton, is a shrub native to China. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often brightly colored leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by woody, fleshy capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
